channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Massive urinating smell., 31st July
item.description:
Big pong coming from both sides of the underpass of marylebone flyover both sides of edgware road. There are bike racks there but also half a dozen tents. The smell under there is horrendous. Please can it be cleaned with detergent. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Marylebone Road, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge fly tip at Linslade House bins, 31st July
item.description:
There is a huge fly tip at the bins at Linslade house including sofa, lots of parts of a bed frame and other rubbish. It’s been here 2 weeeks please collect all of it. Also rubbish at the other bins. Please remove asap it’s very unpleasant

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Whiston Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped bags outside our flats, 31st July
item.description:
These bags have been left for several weeks and we don’t know who left them there as they don’t belong to any of the residents. The refuse collectors haven’t touched them despite my reporting previously. They’re on the path to the right of the Crown Court flats and the What3Words code is ///soaks.wiring.lifts

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Victoria Road, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No.86 bins keep occupying road outside no.88/86, 31st July
item.description:
This problem for a while. Council just mark problem as fixed. But it keep occupying the road almost everyday. The day not doing. Is those selfish people parking their car there. Is greenwich council allowing this now? If yes, I think I should do the same.

item.category: Fly-tip Small - Less than one bag

item.title: Gas cannisters dumped, 31st July
item.description:
Dealing going on in the street and the surrounding streets covered in these things. Appalling that the council are not cleaning streets and attemp6to stop fly tipping. I dont want to witness this daily and live in a dump. Grove Park is getting worse for fly tipping and unclean streets

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Balder Rise, Chinbrook, London

item.title: Multiple bags of dog waste and other litter, 31st July
item.description:

item.title: Large volume of garden type rubbish, 31st July
item.description:

item.title: Dumped fridge and gas cannisters, 31st July
item.description:
Fly tipping on a daily basis on this Rd always gas cannisters abandoned. No road sweeping shameful having to walk past this daily. Embarrassing living in Grove Park. The council need to do something fast.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Somertrees Avenue, Chinbrook, London

item.title: Dumped doors and gas cannisters, 31st July
item.description:
Both Balder Rise and Somertrees Avenue are littered with flytipping up and down the Rd. Gas cannisters by the box load, dumped fridge, doors, pavements full of weeds, no road sweepers. It is embarrassing living in a place like this. People are dumping in the corner of Balder Rise both ends daily and Somertrees Avenue. Shameful of Lewisham council to let this area become so disgusting. Halfway down Balder Rise there is a box full of gas cannisters. Drug dealing is witnessed in the Rd regularly. What do we pay council tax for!!!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Balder Rise, Chinbrook, London
Report on FixMyStreet
